RoleDescription:
Full Time Furniture Sales Associate + Key Holder for AllModern (A Wayfair Specialty Brand)
Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our AllModern retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store  might be the future home for your career.
The base pay for this position is $24.50 per hour.

Engage and connect with customers and drive sales by asking thoughtful questions to understand their needs and style, guiding them through their questions, and providing the best options for their homes.
Support associates to help drive exceptional customer service and maintain a strong visible presence in the designated work area to drive sales and foster a great customer experience.

Deliver and drive individual and team sales and service KPIs, productivity standards and store goals by providing coaching and support to the Sales team.
Lead the use of utilization design tools, CRM software and client accounts for consistent customer experience and record keeping.

Depending on the specific work shift, this associate will help open and/or close the store, with keyholder responsibilities. Opening and closing regularly. 
Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual, cleanliness, and safety standards of the store and back of house.
Engage in a high energy and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.

What youll need:

2+ years experience motivating and coaching a team to achieve sales goals (preferably as a store Leader or Trainer).
Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.
Strong sales, organization, self-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
An ability to handle customer escalations and demonstrate professional maturity
Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
Strong technical acumen to learn necessary software and hardware; proficiency in Google. Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications, as well as proficiency in operating tablets and POS systems.
Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment, with an ability to adapt and grow.
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

 

Able to speak, read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 75 lbs with assistance.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

Title: Software Engineer II - Early Careers
RoleDescription:
Software Engineer II - Early Careers
Summer 2025 Start
Location: Boston, MA 

The salary range for this position is $150,00-160,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 

This is a Boston, MA based opportunity with a 3 day in office expectation.
 
Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 3-5 years of experience.
 
Wayfair is on a mission to find the most talented engineers entering the tech world! Do you love innovating and creating new tools from scratch? Were looking for engineers who love sharing ideas, collaborating to improve them, and being a part of the full software development process. Our engineers are enthusiastic problem solvers and our teams are highly collaborative. 
 
Wayfair is looking for candidates who are passionate about programming, and have strong core fundamentals. If you feel confident in your knowledge of object oriented design, data structures, & algorithms and your ability to grow your skills over time, please apply! We want to connect with developers who are eager to work in a highly collaborative team and add to Wayfairs culture. You will have the opportunity to work on one of the following teams:
 
Global Supplier Tech: Wayfair sells millions of products and this team owns all the data, tools, and systems that create and manage the content on the site related to each product. We build tools for our thousands of suppliers to send us content we need to be able to sell their products on site. This team makes sure the customer has the information they need to be confident when purchasing for their home. Within Catalog, there are also teams such as pricing & competitive intelligence engineering, merchandising & media engineering, and virtual media.
 
Platforms Tech: Responsible for the entire Wayfair website and all backend components that fuels and powers production. You can be an embedded engineer or a platform engineer. Embedded engineers work directly with engineering verticals to build and consult in building new initiatives. Platform engineers are subject matter experts for languages and engineering tools. You can expect to work with engineers that thrive in collaboration and expertise in one of Wayfairs supported languages or frameworks including Java, .NET, Python, PHP, Backstage, Buildkite, or SonarQube. You can expect to work with engineers that thrive in collaboration and expertise in one of Wayfairs supported languages (Java, .NET, Python, PHP, Javascript, with some Golang and Rust) and frameworks (Backstage, Buildkite, SonarQube, Puppet, Terraform and others).
 
Search, Marketing, and Recommendations Tech: Provides the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Our systems leverage Wayfairs extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models.
 
Storefront Tech: We develop the features, web services, and data architecture that provide a world-class shopping engine for our millions of unique daily customers. We work in small, cross-functional agile teams to develop, deploy, and iterate on new experiences by partnering with Product, Experience Design, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair. Our Websites and Native Apps are built on a foundation of highly-scalable technologies and supports tens of millions of products. We tackle exciting problems that are reshaping how people discover, find, purchase and have goods delivered to their homes. We are a diverse, multidisciplinary team of world-class engineers with a highly visible workstream that drives significant impact.
 
Supply Chain Retail Tech: Develops the complex, ground-breaking logistics system to help move the products Wayfair sells from suppliers to warehouses to customers. Supply Chain is responsible for international transportation, warehouse management, and the customer delivery network making it all possible.
 
What Youll Need: 
 
Basic Qualifications

3-5 years of transferable software development experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or another related technical discipline

 
Preferred Qualifications

Excellent team player with a passion for collaboration
You have experience with full stack and/or mobile development
You are familiar with creating software tools and functionality, debugging code, and successfully incorporating feedback into your work
You have knowledge and experience working with object oriented programming languages
You have great skills in solving complex problems with simple abstract solutions
You have experience or exposure to SQL, Java, and Python
You have an interest in working with big data and machine learning
You may have experience with using cloud platforms to solve problems
You may have experience working in agile environments
You enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to make a project or tool on your own
You have strong communication skills

 
What Youll Do:
 

Support designing and perform hands-on building of applications that are reliable, scalable and easy to maintain
Ensure that engineering quality standards are met within your team
Contribute to architectural and code review discussions that impact our engineering ecosystem
Collaborate with leads and engineers on your team to solve a wide variety of business and technical problems
Ensure our systems are properly documented
Contribute to the growth and development of the Wayfair engineering organization

Title: Senior Associate, Global Partner Support Platform Programs
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $83,500-92,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Do you thrive working at the intersection of technology and operations? Are you passionate about leveraging new technology and AI to drive operational excellence and efficiency? If so, join Wayfairs Global Partner Support (GPS) Platform Programs team as a Senior Associate!
Our team is responsible for improving partner support operations for Wayfairs suppliers, carriers, and customers by driving technology and process enhancements. This team collaborates closely with product management, engineering, and support teams to implement scalable solutions that enhance the supplier experience. We execute strategic initiatives that enhance supplier support through new software system capabilities, platform migrations, and AI-powered solutions. In this role, you will drive high-impact projects that improve support processes for over 20,000+ suppliers worldwide.
Youll be instrumental in shaping tech-driven enhancements, optimizing automation, and driving digital transformationensuring that Wayfair remains an industry leader in supplier support innovation.
What You'll Do:

Lead Tech Projects: Spearhead large-scale, cross-functional technology projects, including platform migrations and system upgrades, in close collaboration with product, engineering, and operations teams.
Drive Automation & AI Initiatives: Identify and implement AI-driven enhancements and automation opportunitiesfrom sentiment analysis to workflow optimizationto improve efficiency and the partner experience.
Optimize Processes: Analyze support trends and leverage data to refine support workflows, enhance ticketing systems, and improve self-service capabilities.
Manage Strategic Execution: Define project roadmaps, manage milestones, and track KPIs to measure the business impact of your initiatives, ensuring on-time and high-quality delivery.

What You'll Need:

Bachelor's degree
2-3 years of experience in technical project management, consulting, operations, or a similar technology-focused role.

Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Just last year alone our team has contributed to hundreds of millions in incremental revenue. We do this by leveraging Wayfair's extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models. Our platforms and services are used to power experiences for search, browse across multiple  storefront and marketing channels and are called over a billion times a day.

Build scalable, maintainable, and highly interactive user interfaces using ReactJS, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3.

Collaborate in Agile teams and contribute to sprint planning, code reviews, and continuous improvement practices.

What You'll Need:

24 years of professional experience in front-end development using ReactJS and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS3, TypeScript, and responsive design principles.
Familiarity with backend technologies such as Java (Spring Boot) and experience writing or debugging SQL queries.
Experience integrating front-end components with REST APIs or GraphQL services.
Solid understanding of front-end state management patterns (e.g., Redux, Context API).
Basic understanding of containerised deployment environments such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
Knowledge of modern development tools and build systems (Webpack, Babel, NPM/Yarn).
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work across teams.
Good documentation skills for writing and maintaining technical specifications and project artifacts.

Nice to Have:

Familiarity with monitoring/logging tools like Elasticsearch, Grafana, or Prometheus.
Understanding of messaging systems like Kafka or Redis.

Title: Commercial Strategy Associate - Early Careers (Summer 2025 Start)
RoleDescription:
Summer 2025 start 
Location: Boston, MA
Additional Details:

This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation (Monday - Thursday) with 1 day remote (Friday).
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN

Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
Who We Are:
Wayfairs Commercial organization delivers on Wayfairs promise to help everyone anywhere create their feeling of home through building an unparalleled selection, driving tangible value, and ensuring a seamless customer experience. This team builds strong relationships with suppliers to provide true partnership in helping customers create a space that reflects who they are and what they need. They attract, grow, and retain Wayfairs customer base through innovative marketing strategies. This team curates and refines product collections to enhance and optimize the shopping journey. As an Associate, youll develop and execute strategies that generate competitive advantages for Wayfair, and the results of your findings will improve the end-to-end supplier and customer experience.
What Youll Do:

Analyze data and trends to improve the quality of our product catalog in order to increase customer satisfaction, trust, and site conversion rates; researching categories and vendors to build out selection
Create cross-functional partnerships to advance your category and suppliers through merchandising, promotions, marketing, on-trend product selection, effective pricing and profitability, and operational excellence
Create and enforce best practice guidelines to enrich product assortment, optimizing processes to enable high quality & efficiency while guaranteeing an easily digestible experience for suppliers & internal stakeholders
Build key supplier relationships to enable successful negotiations and push towards a best-in-class customer experience
Leverage data to analyze the competitive environment, report on performance trends, and develop business cases for strategic initiatives
Represent Wayfair at various offsite events such as trade shows
Manage communication with internal and external stakeholders

What Youll Need:
Basic Qualifications:

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future

Preferred Qualifications:

Analytical mindset able to process large volumes of data using a variety of reporting tools (Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, etc.)
Ability to distill complex information in a simplistic way via emails, charts, graphs, and other forms of presentations
Passionate about execution with a strong interest to drive customer engagement
Desire to own projects from beginning to end, and thrive as part of a team as well as individually
Comfortable navigating a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong project management and prioritization skills

As a Commercial Strategy Associate, youll join our teams that are driving Wayfairs best-in-class online customer experience. Youll be responsible for owning and maintaining Wayfairs vast e-commerce catalog, executing strategy for product categories and managing supplier relationships, and continually improving the customers on-site shopping experience. 
Possible Team Placements Include:
B2B
Wayfair Professional (aka Wayfair B2B) is an industry leading business to business sales organization dedicated to help businesses make good spaces great. Wayfair Professional is the gated experience of Wayfair dedicated to all business customers. We organize our customer base and corresponding offering (site and sales) into 7 industry verticals, prioritizing our Interior Design, Commercial Office and Contractor experiences. We are on a journey to being a $5B+ business by 2025 (+30% YoY growth), with over a $300B opportunity to cover across North America and Europe over the subsequent 10 years.
Catalog Health
In this role, you will own offshore operations, manage inbound requests, and oversee the supplier and product delisting process, ensuring a healthy and trustworthy catalog that abides by our Code of Conduct. You will work cross-functionally with Business and Technology teams to improve operational workflows, identify opportunities for efficiency, and inform key business strategies. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, is a problem-solver with strong communication skills, and enjoys collaborating with multiple stakeholders to drive impactful results. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in e-commerce operations, working closely with cross-functional teams to improve catalog health and drive efficiency at scale. If you are a proactive problem-solver with a passion for operational excellence, wed love to hear from you!
Catalog Merchandising
The Global Merchandising organization is responsible for building and maintaining Wayfairs e-commerce catalog of over 24 million+ products. The organization consists of multiple teams who each play a crucial role in defining and executing on best-in-class merchandising. The Global Merchandising teams guide the management of our enormous product catalog and provide suppliers with tools to continually expand our product assortment. The Merch teams drive product discovery, consideration, and purchase on all of our stores and marketing channels by ensuring customers have complete, accurate, and relevant product information, and by removing friction for suppliers to provide it. The Data Integrations & Analytics teams leverage Big Data to optimize internal merchandising processes. Together, these teams deliver on key merchandising goals. 
Category Management
The Category Management team drives strategy for Wayfairs product categories through tight internal and external partnership. We serve as ambassadors of the product categories we manage. We are at the forefront as Wayfair redefines the supplier experience as a platform, giving suppliers more data, more transparency, and more control while retaining the high-touch elements that make working with Wayfair exceptional. Internally, we leverage a diverse set of cross-functional partners to execute our strategic vision. In a role on the Category Management team, you will be expected to define overarching goals and strategy within your category, problem-solve, articulate and execute against tactical plans, and manage key business metrics. Members of the team must be able to expertly negotiate internally and externally, while also being effective project managers.
Merchandising Compliance
Our Merchandising Compliance team is responsible for keeping our customers safe, and our products, services and offerings in compliance with applicable federal or local regulations. We support those efforts through building efficient processes and scalable technology solutions. If youre passionate about driving business impact by working cross functionally, love working through complex operations decisions, and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.
North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics 
The North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics Team empowers stakeholders across the Global Supplier Organization, enabling teams to grow their businesses. As an associate you would help streamline processes, organize internal and external communication with regard to program updates, new tools, etc, and work closely with data to draw conclusions and influence stakeholders.
Perigold 
Perigold is Wayfairs newest brand, targeting the luxury home market. We are focused on providing an unparalleled assortment of luxury home goods through an elevated online shopping experience for our customers. We do this by connecting the best brands with our luxury customers while working on product curation, brand marketing and storytelling, building a best-in-class site experience, and providing best-in-class service and delivery. We serve as ambassadors for the categories we manage by identifying and solving unique customer and supplier challenges. Internally, we partner with various teams including Profit Management, Merchandising, Partner Operations, Marketing, Brand and Curated Merchandising and Promotions to bring the Perigold vision to life.
Scalable Purchasing, B2B Customer Enablement Team
Wayfairs B2B and Global Sales teams support Wayfair Professional and high-value Sales customers. The Customer Enablement (CE) team designs and implements customer-centric experiences that add value for our B2B and Sales customers. We serve customers via a gated site experience that is tailored based on a given customers vertical (e.g., Commercial Office, Interior Design, Contractor). The Scalable Purchasing team within Customer Enablement is focused on enabling transactional shopping behavior at scale: meeting business customers wherever they are. Focused on both digital transformation and change enablements required to meet customers needs. We seek a motivated associate with a leadership mindset who will partner with vertical leaders and customer enablement team members to optimize the customer journey to consistently exceed revenue targets and improve the customer experience. This role will help to implement transformative projects to enable scalable purchasing at large. Some examples of this include: enabling E-procurement &amp; Financing unlocks for B2B customers. The role will report to the Scalable Purchasing Lead and partner directly with cross-functional teams (B2B CM, Sales Tech, Revenue Operations, B2B Finance Operations, Fintech &amp; Sales Teams) to drive overall customer journey improvements. This includes proactively partnering with analytics to monitor performance and improve how we identify / prioritize customers, designing and implementing step-change improvements to the customer journey, and driving cross-functional projects that optimize the site-, sales-, or marketing treatment.
Supplier Advertising & Merch Services
The Supplier Advertising team sells and advocates the use of our advertising suite of products to our supplier base. We help suppliers stand out on site and amplify their exposure off site. The team is focused on driving: the maximum performance for every dollar a supplier spends with us and significant high margin revenue to Wayfairs bottom line.
Supplier Inventory Management
On the Supplier Inventory Management team, we partner with thousands of suppliers to maximize customers experience. This means driving speed and availability through supplier inventory and positioning strategies, leveraging both Wayfairs fulfillment services (CastleGate) as well as suppliers existing supply chains. On this team, you'll have a "COO" mindset, and be responsible for individual supplier and category inventory strategy, including integrating with Wayfair's e-comm and physical retail.

Wayfairs Performance Creative team is seeking a data-driven Senior Creative Strategist to lead the development of innovative, insight-led ad creative across paid social and digital channels. This is a key role at the intersection of storytelling, design, and data, focused on producing high-performing creative that drives measurable impact across the funnel on platforms like Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and beyond.
As part of a fast-paced, cross-functional team, youll collaborate with performance marketers, designers, editors, and data analysts to translate business goals into compelling customer-facing creative. You will own end-to-end campaign ideationfrom research and messaging strategy to creative testing and optimizationensuring every asset we launch upholds brand integrity, follows channel best practices, and is built to convert.
This role is ideal for a creative strategist with 5+ years of experience in performance-driven environments who thrives on balancing storytelling with experimentation, and can bring structure and strategic clarity to a high-volume creative pipeline.
What You'll Do:

Own the Creative Strategy for Paid Campaigns: Lead strategy for ad creative across key paid channels including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, Paid Search, and programmatic. Develop insight-driven concepts tailored to platform behavior, audience mindset, and performance goals.
Drive End-to-End Campaign Development: Develop compelling creative concepts, messaging frameworks, and testing roadmaps grounded in insights. Collaborate with SEO and Consumer Insights teams to ensure strategies are data-informed, and partner with designers and producers to bring ideas to lifefrom initial edits to final delivery.
Craft and Manage UGC Briefs: Own the creation of strategic creative briefs for user-generated content (UGC) partners, ensuring content is aligned to campaign objectives, performance goals, and channel best practices.
Translate Insights into Impact: Analyze performance data and audience behavior to inform testing priorities and future creative iterations. Develop hypotheses, build testing matrices, and partner with performance marketers to continually optimize and unlock incremental performance gains.
Track and Share Creative Learnings: Monitor creative performance trends and consolidate learnings to inform future strategy. Proactively share insights and recommendations with the broader creative and marketing teams to promote a culture of continuous learning and data-driven iteration.
Cross-Functional Leadership: Act as a creative point of contact for the Marketing team, ensuring strategic alignment across creative and media plans. Present ideas and creative rationale to stakeholders with confidence and clarity.
Support Seasonal Campaign Launches: Collaborate with the Go-To-Market (GTM) team to influence and direct seasonal campaign creative, ensuring assets are optimized for paid channels and grounded in SEO insights while identifying content gaps. 
Mentor and Inspire: Help guide designers by providing actionable feedback, moodboards, and strategic direction. Champion experimentation, iteration, and scrappy production methods to maximize learning velocity.
Leverage & Repurpose Assets: Strategically utilize existing lifestyle, studio, 3D, and UGC video and static assets to scale output efficiently across channels while maintaining creative effectiveness.

What You'll Need:

5+ years of experience concepting, writing, and producing direct response ads in a fast-paced and high volume environment, such as a digital marketing agency or an in-house growth team, ideally in e-commerce or DTC.
1+ years of experience working directly with paid media (Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, etc.) as a media buyer or equivalent role, with a clear understanding of how creative impacts performance.
Experience with Facebook Ads Manager, creative testing tools, and performance reporting dashboards
A proven ability to develop and scale direct response creative that drives measurable results.
Deep understanding of platform-specific creative best practices, including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and other emerging formats.
Strong creative instincts with a focus on clarity, conversion, and audience empathy.
Experience working with graphic designers, video editors, content creators, and production teams to ship high volumes of content.
Familiarity with testing methodologies, performance metrics, and using data to guide creative iterations.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects across different stakeholders and timelines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to guide copywriters on scripts, headlines, and performance-oriented copy.
Comfort working in a hybrid, collaborative environment that values speed, curiosity, and creativity.

Portfolio or examples of past campaigns, especially those tied to performance metrics, are highly encouraged.
Bonus:

Experience with creative automation platforms or modular content systems for the consistent production of a high volume of creative assets
Prior experience in retail, home, or lifestyle categories
Interest and knowledge of cutting-edge technology such as AI-generated content and VO
Familiarity with creative tools (e.g., Figma, Adobe Creative Suite) is a plus for providing clear design feedback, but this is not a design role.

Title: Senior ML Scientist, Advertising Optimization & Automation Science
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.Who We Are:Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
The Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team is central to this effort. We leverage machine learning and generative AI to streamline campaign workflows, delivering impactful recommendations on budget allocation, target Return on Ad Spend (tROAS), and SKU selection. Additionally, we are developing intelligent systems for creative optimization and exploring agentic frameworks to further simplify and enhance advertiser interactions.
We are looking for an experienced Senior Machine Learning Scientist to join the Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team. In this role, you will be responsible for building intelligent, ML-powered systems that drive personalized recommendations and campaign automation within Wayfairs advertising platform. You will work closely with other scientists, as well as members of our internal Product and Engineering teams, to apply your ML expertise to define and deliver 0-to-1 capabilities that unlock substantial commercial value and directly enhance advertiser outcomes. 
What Youll do:

Design and build intelligent budget, tROAS, and SKU recommendations, and simulation-driven decisioning that extends beyond the current advertising platform capabilities.
Lead the next phase of GenAI-powered creative optimization and automation to drive significant incremental ad revenue and improve supplier outcomes.
Raise technical standards across the team by promoting best practices in ML system design and development. 
Partner cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Sales to deliver scalable ML solutions that improve supplier campaign performance. Ensure systems are designed for reuse, extensibility, and long-term impact across multiple advertising workflows.
Research and apply best practices in advertising science, GenAI applications in creative personalization, and auction modeling. Keep Wayfair at the forefront of innovation in supplier marketing optimization.
Collaborate with Engineering teams (AdTech, ML Platform, Campaign Management) to build and scale the infrastructure needed for automated, intelligent advertising decisioning.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
9+ years of experience in building large scale machine learning algorithms.
4+ years of experience working in an architect or technical leadership position. 
Strong theoretical understanding of statistical models such as regression, clustering and ML algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, transformers and NLP techniques. 
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and relevant ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) to develop production-grade products.
Strategic thinker with a customer-centric mindset and a desire for creative problem solving, looking to make a big impact in a growing organization. 
Demonstrated success influencing senior level stakeholders on strategic direction based on recommendations backed by in-depth analysis; Excellent written and verbal communication.
Ability to partner cross-functionally to own and shape technical roadmaps Intellectual curiosity and a desire to always be learning!

Nice to have:

Experience with GCP, Airflow, and containerization (Docker).
Experience building scalable data processing pipelines with big data tools such as Hadoop, Hive, SQL, Spark, etc.
Familiarity with Generative AI and agentic workflows.
Experience in Bayesian Learning, Multi-armed Bandits, or Reinforcement Learning.

Title: Software Engineering Manager, App Aquire & Activate
RoleDescription:
Engineering Manager - App Acquire & Activate (Toronto TDC)
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Toronto, Canada and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Partnering with Product, Experience Design, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair, our Native App Engineering teams contribute to an award-winning mobile experience that makes shopping for your home delightful and engaging. iOS and Android engineers leverage the full capabilities of mobile devices and their SDKs. For example, our apps take advantage of augmented reality, computer vision-assisted product search using the devices camera, and machine learning to create personalized experiences and improve the speed of the app.
 
The App Acquire & Activate team charter is to facilitate smooth onboarding of customers and continuous engagement and retention during our customers shopping and home project lifecycle by creating new value propositions for the Wayfair App Experience designed to serve the needs of early lifecycle and low-purchase intent users. The ideal candidate has experience in native app development (iOS or Android), and a proven track record of managing stakeholders and external partners. Experience or general interest in modern native application development techniques, Artificial Intelligence and GraphQL is a big plus!  This person will leverage their breadth of knowledge in these areas to lead and grow a multi-disciplinary engineering team that delivers features for Wayfair shoppers to make their shopping experience frictionless and delightful.
 
What You'll Do

Lead a team of iOS and Android developers working on features and tech that powers our native apps shopping experience.
Promote, coach, and drive a high quality culture into the team and organization
Proactively manage critical project issues, risks and challenges, utilizing project management tools and business expertise to deliver projects.
Lead and drive engineering initiatives from inception to development, and deployment. Initiatives may cut across multiple aspects of the applications.
Work closely with product management and business stakeholders to understand and translate business objectives into technical solutions.
Represent the engineering team in cross-functional projects and to the company at large.
Utilize strong leadership skills to build the best high performing team.
Coach, mentor, and keep 1:1 with team members as well as gather feedback and implement necessary improvements.
Ensure high quality and performance standards for the Wayfair mobile platform.
Oversee the definition of best practices and coding standards across the entire team; review code and provide guidance for other code reviewers participating in our release approval process.  
Use data and metrics to collaboratively drive impactful changes across the application; work closely with product and engineering management to anticipate areas for improvement and investment, and highlight these for inclusion in the team's project roadmap.

At least 3+ years of engineering leadership or management experience
At least 7+ years of software development experience with ideally 3+ years of native app development (iOS or Android)
Experience in either Swift or Kotlin in building mobile applications with a desire to continuously learn as you strive to develop and improve your team.
Knowledge of mobile software design patterns and experience working with a variety of architectures.
Experience recruiting, managing, fostering and retaining talent on a technical team.
Agile experience and extensive experience working on an agile development team.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
High level of accountability, bias to action and a desire to empower individuals on the team to perform at their best.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Customer Data Platforms
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bengaluru, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not frustration. Our Product team plays a crucial role in delivering on this vision by developing best-in-class platforms and systems that enable personalized, scalable, and impactful customer experiences across our global business.
The Customer Identity & Understanding team is building the foundational systems that power Wayfairs personalization and targeting capabilities. Our mission is to deeply understand who our customers are, even before they log in, and make that intelligence actionable across the company. We develop the core Customer Data Platform (CDP), including identity resolution, cross-device and cross-session stitching, feature engineering pipelines for machine learning, and geo-based inference engines to personalize for every customer, including in cold-start scenarios.
We are looking for a Senior Product Manager who thrives at the intersection of data platforms, machine learning, and customer-centric strategy. Youll define the product roadmap for customer data collection and activation, balancing long-term architectural bets with high-impact applications that power recommendations, marketing, and broader shopping experiences. Youll work closely with Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and teams across Wayfair to unlock scalable, privacy-aware insights about our customers.
You are a technical systems thinker with a strong product sense, excellent communication skills, and the ability to translate messy customer signals into clean, high-signal data products.
What Youll Do

Define and execute the roadmap for Customer Identity & Understanding, including:

Our deterministic and probabilistic identity graph, enabling persistent recognition of customers across devices, browsers, and sessions
The customer feature platform, powering personalization and ML model features across surfaces (Search, Recommendations, Marketing, etc.)
Enrichment pipelines for geo-based personalization, cold-start user inference, and audience understanding

Partner with engineering to make architectural tradeoffs that balance long-term scalability, data quality, and time-to-impact
Drive alignment across partner teams on data definitions, customer segmentation needs, and attribution approaches
Collaborate with legal, privacy, and security teams to ensure all identity solutions are built with privacy-by-design principles
Evangelize customer intelligence as a strategic differentiator for the business, tying your roadmap to downstream metrics (CTR, CVR, AOV, LTV)
Translate stakeholder needs into well-scoped platform enhancements that are modular, reusable, and performance-aware
Establish and track KPIs for data completeness, freshness, uniqueness, and downstream business usage

What youll Need

7+ years of product management experience, ideally building data or ML platforms or leading identity resolution or CDP-type initiatives
Strong technical acumen: you can converse comfortably with engineers about architecture, data pipelines, APIs, and event tracking
Demonstrated experience designing and shipping products that unlock ML feature engineering or personalization capabilities at scale
Working knowledge of probabilistic matching, cookie/device stitching, and geo-IP or cold-start inference approaches
Comfort operating in ambiguous problem spaces with many stakeholders and interconnected systems
Excellent communication and influence skills  you can align execs, engineers, and analysts alike with a crisp vision and clear priorities
Hands-on experience with SQL, experimentation frameworks, and debugging data integrity issues
Bachelors degree in a technical or analytical field preferred (e.g., CS, Engineering, Math, or Economics)

Title: Data Scientist II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements. 
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Customer Tech Data Science team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior on the website and mobile application as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems.
At their core, the Customer Tech Data Science team at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business and applying advanced modeling techniques. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance.
What Youll Do:
As a Data Scientist, youll play a critical role in uncovering insights that shape strategic decisions and improve business performance. You will explore data trends, diagnose gaps, and identify growth & innovation opportunities across Wayfairs data. Your work will directly impact how the company understands performance and makes data-informed decisions.

Conduct in-depth analysis across large-scale datasets (clickstream, sales, product, logistics, and customer data) to uncover trends, gaps, and business opportunities.
Champion the use of emerging technologies - including GenAI and LLMs - to transform how we explore data and uncover insights, unlocking new ways to accelerate analysis, automate complex workflows, and make insights more accessible and actionable across the business.
Become a subject matter expert on key business metrics and customer behavior, ensuring accurate interpretation and analysis.
Drive innovation in business analysis by adopting and implementing new methodologies (e.g., key driver analysis, anomaly detection, forecasting, cohorting).
Establish robust KPI tracking and anomaly detection systems to ensure early identification of emerging issues and opportunities.
Collaborate with cross-functional partnersincluding Business Strategy, Product, and Engineeringto uncover actionable insights that drive growth and improve customer experience.
Design, run, and interpret A/B tests to make high-impact changes to the customer experience.
Build, automate, and maintain scalable dashboards and reports using tools like Looker, BigQuery (GBQ), SQL and Python to enable efficient and self-serve data access for stakeholders.
Develop optimized and maintainable code pipelines to transform multi-terabyte data into meaningful business insights and recommendations.

What You'll Need:

Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
2 - 4 years of work experience in a relevant field, such as analytics or data science.
Proficient knowledge of a statistical programming language such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS.
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. Aggregate functions, joins, etc.).
Experience conducting quantitative analyses on large and complex data sets.
Experience in leveraging modeling algorithms to derive business insights.
Experience with experimental test design such as A/B testing.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI); experience with Looker a plus.
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems.
Strong written and verbal communication.
Ecommerce or retail analytics experience is a plus.

Wayfair is currently seeking a Senior People Analyst to lead our people analytics strategy for the Technology organization.  In this role, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our talent strategy and enhancing the employee experience through data-driven insights. You will leverage your analytical expertise to uncover trends, identify opportunities, and empower leaders to make informed decisions across the talent lifecycle.
The ideal candidate will have an affinity for solving business problems through innovative approaches - quantitative and qualitative - and will be able to keep an eye on the bigger picture, looking around corners, while diving deep into our data sets and processes. Proactively identify opportunities for insight generation and scope new projects that elevate the People Analytics roadmap in alignment with Tech strategy.

Lead projects spanning the full talent lifecycle, including annual voice, attrition, and team health reporting, ensuring analyses drive action through hiring, development, and retention in partnership with Talent Business Partners and Talent central teams.
Automate recurring people analytics projects to deliver insight more regularly and scalably to leaders and stakeholders.
Turn data into actionable insights that tell a cohesive story and deliver business recommendations that resonate with executive stakeholders (Director+).

Manage, mentor and onboard junior employees within the team to build leadership skill set.
Respect the sensitivity, privacy, and confidentiality of candidate and employee data by adhering to best practices for data governance.

Experience with spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets) and BI/data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Visier) preferred

Integrity and honesty, and, above all, a respect for complete confidentiality

Title: Product Manager, Physical Retail Sales & Service
RoleDescription:
Who We Are [Physical Retail Sales & Service]
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.
The Physical Retail Sales & Service team is responsible for the technology experience that powers our brick-and-mortar stores. The Product Manager in this role will unify two core areas of focus: (1) enabling customer self-service through tools like digital displays, e-labels, and our in-store mobile app, and (2) equipping store associates with a bespoke point of sale system that integrates seamlessly with our specialty, omni-channel sales and service tools.

Partner with design, engineering, analytics, and retail stakeholders to build scalable, measurable solutions that improve conversion, satisfaction, and operational efficiency.
Manage cross-functional projects from discovery through delivery, ensuring tight alignment with physical retail strategy.
Translate complex workflows into clear product requirements and cross-domain contracts.
Champion associate and customer needs while balancing business goals and technical constraints.
Communicate product vision and progress to stakeholders across the company, including senior leadership.

What Youll Need

4+ years building software products at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
Experience with consumer-facing or retail associate tools preferred.
Strong technical background and ability to break down complex problems into incremental value delivery.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills across technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfort with data and a passion for using it to drive decision-making; SQL a plus.
Understanding of how tools and platforms integrate in omni-channel retail settings.
A bias for action and customer-focused innovation mindset.

Title: Head of Pricing & Forecasting Science, Global Supplier Technology
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $216,000 - $228,000. Base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. 
Who We Are:The Pricing, Profitability, and Demand Forecasting group is a team of approximately 20 full-time economists and ML scientists. We are a collaborative and lively scientific community working at the core of Wayfair's commercial strategy. Our team partners closely with engineering, data science, product, and commercial leaders to solve complex challenges and shape the company's future through the strategic application of science. As the leader of this group, you will be central to this mission, guiding the teams that drive our technical and business impact.
What Youll Do:

Lead the technical strategy for the pricing, profitability, and forecasting organization to solve large, complex problems in measurement, prediction, optimization, and forecasting.
Design and build scalable solutions that ensure system interoperability and scientific rigor.
Integrate underlying models into a unified technology platform that supports stakeholders with diverse needs, helping them reach sound causal conclusions.
Grow and develop a high performing science team, by mentoring and providing guidance to junior team members to enhance their skills.
Collaborate with leaders in engineering, product management, data science, and business leadership to address complex problems holistically.
Influence company-wide strategic decisions in the pricing space by translating complex ideas for non-technical audiences.

Were Excited About You Because You Have:

PhD in quantitative fields (Economics, Quantitative Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, etc.).
7+ years of industry experience in one or more of the following: observational causal inference, experimentation, or building and maintaining large-scale measurement systems.
2+ years of industry experience managing individual contributors as well as managers in a high performing science organization.
Proficient coding skills: advanced experience in Python for machine learning and causal inference, along with familiarity with workflow tools (e.g., Airflow, Composer) for batch and real-time processes and cloud-native technologies.
A proven track record of delivering large-scale technical projects with significant business impact.
The ability to work closely with senior business stakeholders, translate complex ideas for non-experts, and influence strategic decisions at the Director+ level.

Nice to have:


Experience in building optimization algorithms powered by causal inference system in price, marketing, or ads,
Experience in scaling causal inference models that blend observational and experimental data.
Familiarity with GCP and Vertex AI.

Title: Manager, Freight Sales
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented Sales Agent to drive the adoption and growth of end to end Integrated Logistics using Castle Gate, including Freight Forwarding, drayage Multichannel and 3PL offerings. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying and engaging with potential customers, articulating the value proposition of our services, closing new business and building the relationship with stakeholders. You will play a critical role in expanding Wayfair's presence in the logistics space and contributing to the success of our CastleGate Fulfillment program.
Responsibilities:

Sales Execution:

Conduct outbound sales efforts to generate new leads and identify potential customers for the entire E2E logistics service, Castle Gate, Multichannel and 3PL services, ocean freight, drayage etc.
Manage a pipeline of prospective customers, from initial contact to deal closure.
Present Wayfair's E2E Logistics service package to enable more Multichannel and 3PL offerings, highlighting competitive advantages such as speed, service levels, and cost-effectiveness.
Work with customers to understand their current logistics challenges and demonstrate how Wayfair's solutions can address their needs.
Negotiate and close contracts for Multichannel and 3PL services.
Drive volume commitments from customers to meet and exceed sales targets.

Supplier Engagement & Support:

Gather and relay supplier feedback on rate cards, service levels, and competitive offerings to internal teams.
Address supplier questions and concerns regarding tracking, packing slips, and other operational aspects.
Collaborate with the CastleGate Product team to identify and resolve supplier-surfaced gaps in the offerings.
Educate customers on the benefits of our "all-in" rates compared to base rates quoted by 3PLs.
Emphasize Wayfair's higher level of shipping service compared to competitive 3PLs.

Market Intelligence:

Stay informed about competitive responses from other major retailers (e.g., Amazon, Walmart) in the fulfillment space.
Collect and vet competitive rate cards to inform pricing strategies and identify sweet spots for Wayfair's offerings.

Internal Collaboration:

Work closely with the Supplier Integration and Management (SIM) team, CastleGate Fulfillment, and other internal stakeholders to align on sales strategies and ensure seamless supplier onboarding.
Utilize Salesforce to track leads and manage the sales process.
Contribute to ongoing refinements of our product offerings and pricing


Qualifications:

Proven sales experience 2-3 years, preferably in logistics, supply chain, or e-commerce.
Team management experience 2-3 years.
Strong understanding of 3rd Party Logistics (3PL) and fulfillment operations.
Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
Ability to articulate complex value propositions clearly and concisely.
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong relationships with customers.
Results-oriented with a track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
Familiarity with Salesforce or similar CRM systems is a plus.
Knowledge of Multichannel/3PL fulfillment processes is highly desirable.
